I wish them the best of luck during their yearlong visits to their host countries.   The six recipients are:  Dr. Gregory Alexander from Jefferson City Mr. Kevin Bird from Osage Beach Ms. Brittany Broder from St. Charles Ms. Kathryn Densford from Union Mr. Dylan Gilbert from Saint Peters Mr. Daniel Pieper from O'Fallon

Dr. Greitens has been a champion of foster and adoptive care policy in the State of Missouri for years. Today we sat down and discussed ways we can work together to better strengthen our foster care system and better increase outcomes for young adults transitioning out of the system.

Today is the seventh anniversary of the enactment of Dodd-Frank.   For seven years, the American people have dealt with a stagnant financial economy, evaporating access to financial products, and less opportunity for financial independence. The culprit is Dodd-Frank and the punitive regulatory regime it left in its wake. What was billed as the solution to our economic woes has done little more than create more red tape from Washington. The people and institutions that had no role in the financial crisis bear the brunt of this stifling, Washington-knows-best regulatory regime.   Earlier this year, the House of Representatives acted by passing the Financial CHOICE Act, which creates a more meaningful and effective financial regulatory structure that will restore consumers' faith in their financial system. I look forward to working with my colleagues in the Senate to pass this important legislation so it can get to the President's desk for his signature.

It was great meeting Thomas Reuther from Washington, Missouri today. Thomas is a member of the Congress-Bundestag Youth Exchange for Young Professionals and we discussed his upcoming experience in which he will study, intern, and live in Germany.

With a vote of 419-3, the House passed legislation that will protect U.S. national security and hold Russia, Iran, and North Korea accountable.   This legislation is in direct response to Iran, Russia, and North Korea's continued attempts to undermine global stability with aggressive acts. We will hold these countries accountable by targeting any individual who contributes to or supports their ongoing destabilizing activities.   I am pleased the House of Representatives came together to pass this important bill in bipartisan fashion and I look forward to it being signed into law.
It was wonderful meeting everyone today. Thank you, to everyone, for sharing your stories and enjoy your time in Washington!
I want to thank Nick, Ryan, and Mary for all of their hard work during their summer internship. You will be missed in the office and I wish each of you the best of luck in the future!

With premium increases in Missouri up 145 percent since 2013 and 97 counties with only one choice of insurer this year, it is clear Obamacare is failing. The House of Representatives took the first critical step in saving our country’s health-care system by passing a repeal months ago, but unfortunately the Senate has not been able to follow our lead. The Senate, including the Democrats who forced this horrible law on the American people, must come together to find a path forward. The House stands ready to work with the Senate on a solution that will put families and their doctors back in charge of their health-care.

On August 21, a solar eclipse will envelop the nation - and will go directly through the 3rd District. Until that day, I will be providing some tips and information for you to ensure you safely view the solar eclipse.   Viewers should consider purchasing specially made 'eclipse glasses' or other ISO-certified filters. You can order solar eclipse glasses in advance by going to the American Astronomical Society's website for a list of manufacturers.   Also, did you know that this will be the first total solar eclipse to touch the U.S. mainland since 1979 and the first to cross from coast to coast since 1918?

Thank you to everyone who participated in the human trafficking roundtable in Franklin County today.   Human trafficking impacts every community in our country and the National Human Trafficking hotline recorded more than 7,500 human trafficking cases in the U.S. in 2016. By working with local communities and law enforcement, we can start to crackdown on this epidemic.

Great discussion in Crystal City today with local officials and community leaders about what can be done to combat the opioid epidemic that has hit Jefferson County. I will take their notes and ideas back to Washington to share with my colleagues in the House.

It was an incredible honor to meet the Festus High School Rocket Club. They recently won first place at the International Paris Air Show. It was great to talk with the students and present them with a congratulatory statement that was in the Congressional Record.

Just wrapped up the roundtable focused on opioid abuse and behavioral health at Community Health Center of Central Missouri in Jefferson City. Thank you to everyone who participated in this important discussion including the Director of Missouri's Department of Health and Senior Services, Dr. Randall Williams, the Jefferson City Police Department, the Director of Missouri's Department of Mental Health, Mark Stringer, the Cole County Health Department, and the President and CEO of Jordan Valley Community Health Center, Brooks Miller.

It was an honor to present the Wentzville Civil Air Patrol with a congratulatory statement that was issued in the Congressional Record. These individuals are true community leaders and their commitment to the Civil Air Patrol deserves our appreciation and gratitude.

As my office says goodbye to these great summer interns, Macey and Mikayla, I want to remind you that my Jefferson City District Office has internship openings for the Fall 2017 school semester. The internship will offer students an opportunity to get first-hand experience with how our government works. Please contact my Jefferson City office for more information.

Thank you to the Wentzville Rotary Club for having me speak to you this week. Lots of topics were brought up such as tax reform, efforts to combat opioid abuse, and my work on the House Financial Services Committee. I look forward to speaking with you again soon!

It was a pleasure taking the tour and talking to Jerry Struttman at Scotts Miracle-Gro in Wright City. We discussed all of the products they have and what the business is doing to help the local community. Thank you for having me!
On August 10, 1821, Missouri joined the union. Happy birthday to the great Show-Me State!
With the Missouri State Fair right around the corner, here's a #tbt of me enjoying just some of what the fair has to offer. What are you most looking forward to at this year's state fair?

Habitat for Humanity in St. Charles County has been serving the local and surrounding communities for decades. I had a great meeting with staff members and employees discussing how they serve the county and the results and successes of their projects.

On Monday, August 21, the continental United States will see a solar eclipse. However, Missouri’s 3rd Congressional District is one of few areas across the country that will witness a total blackout of the sun, leaving only the sun’s atmosphere, called the corona, visable.  Many Missourians, including me, are very excited to witness this incredible experience. The total eclipse will stretch all the way from Oregon to South Carolina, covering 14 states inbetween. The longest period when the moon completely blocks the sun from any given location along the path will be approximately two minutes and 40 seconds. In Jefferson City, the moon will first start crossing in front of the sun at 11:46, and the total eclipse will begin at 1:13:07.  The last time the United States saw a total eclipse was in 1979, so an entire generation of Americans have not experienced this phenomenon. This is an excellent opportunity for our region to display our natural beauty, quality way of life, wonderful restaurants and, of course, great baseball teams to the thousands of tourists coming from around the country and globe.  From our state capital, to the Lake of the Ozarks, to the St. Louis area, we are proud of our home state and look forward to welcoming so many to Missouri.   Just as important as the economic value to our local economy, is the safe observation of the eclipse. I urge you to read how to safely view the sun during this event. While some of these tips may be obvious, they must be followed. Please visit eclipse2017.nasa.gov for safety instruction and historical facts.  Lastly, please be sure to share your stories with me via email or Facebook. I would love to hear how the 3rd District celebrates this once in a generation event.
Good Monday morning and happy solar eclipse day! Make sure to share your stories with me and have fun today!
Beautiful sunrise in Gasconade County this morning!

This week, I had the opportunity to congratulate Adient, in Miller County, on the recent achievement of being the first North American Adient plant to receive the Manufacturing Excellence Maturity Level 3. This company employs over 500 people and is an incredible facility. Congratulations!

I went on NRA TV to discuss the Department of Justice's decision to finally put an end to Operation Choke Point once and for all. It is reassuring to see that the Trump Administration's DOJ understands its job is to pursue lawbreakers, not legally-operating businesses.

Good news: late last week, President Trump signed the bipartisan Veterans Appeals Improvement and Modernization Act into law. This bill updates the disability claims appeals process at the Department of VA to ensure veterans receive timely decisions. With this bill now a law, the VA is one step closer to being reconnected with its mission.

My thoughts and prayers are with everyone being affected by Hurricane Harvey. I would also like to thank the brave men and women from around the country, like Missouri Task Force 1, who are putting themselves in harms way to help those in need.
To all of the Missouri workers who make this country great, thank you for all of your hard work. I hope everyone has a safe and relaxing Labor Day with friends and family!

Just walked off the House floor after voting in support of emergency funding for FEMA's Disaster Relief Fund to help recovery efforts due to Hurricane Harvey. These funds will be used to help the ongoing life-saving response and recovery missions and will help those affected get back on their feet.
Is tax reform a top priority for you? Find out more about the House GOP plan here: https://fairandsimple.gop?utm_source=RepBlaineLuetkemeyer

In order to raise awareness for lung cancer in the memory of his mother, John Matthews is currently on a cross-country bike ride from Philadelphia to San Francisco.   Today, John is riding through portions of the 3rd District, including a stop in Sullivan!   We support you, John, and your efforts on this seven week journey to honor your mom and other men and women who have been impacted by this disease.

Grandpa is the most important title that I have added to my name and one of the most rewarding gifts of my life has been watching each of my grandchildren grow and seeing their journeys unfold.   I want to wish a very happy Grandparents Day to all of the grandmas and grandpas across the 3rd District!

Sixteen years ago, we watched as our country was ruthlessly attacked. That day showed the world that Americans are not easily shaken and are prepared to protect our rights and freedom.   Today, we remember all of the victims and families affected by this unspeakable act of terrorism and we honor the brave first responders who lost their lives trying to save their fellow man.

I am pleased to announce that my legislation to designate the USPS in Pacific as the "Specialist Jeffrey L. White, Jr. Post Office" has passed out of committee!  Specialist White dedicated his life to protecting our great nation. It is my great honor to work to dedicate the Pacific Post Office in memory of Specialist White. I am pleased this legislation has completed its first hurdle by passing out of committee and I hope it comes before the House of Representatives for final approval soon.
Great story this morning: Time recently named St. Peters, Missouri as the 15th best place to live in the United States!

Today I received the "Heartbeat Bill Hero" award for my support in protecting the unborn.   All human life is precious and deserves to be treated with the highest dignity and respect. I am humbled to receive this award for my support of the Heartbeat Protection Act, and I hope we can get this critical legislation signed into law soon.

What a truly humbling morning. My friend and the Majority Whip of the House of Representatives Steve Scalise made his first appearance back on the House floor after the June shooting at the Congressional baseball practice. After listening to Steve's words, it is clear God was present on that fateful day as he listened and answered prayers from the tragic event.   Today, Steve mentioned the outpouring support from world leaders and all sorts of individuals throughout the last few months - regardless of ideology. This morning was a good reminder that while we may disagree with one another on matters of policy, we should all treat one another with respect because, at the end of the day, we are all Americans.

I am saddened to hear the news of last night's horrific tragedy in Las Vegas. Let us keep all of those who have been affected in our thoughts and prayers. In addition, thank you to the brave men and women of the Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department who responded swiftly and bravely to last night's events.

It was an absolute pleasure having Elijah Mayfield in the office today. I enjoyed hearing all of his stories and what he has been up to since we last spoke -and it is all truly remarkable. Thank you to Todd and Elijah for the inspiring conversation!

This week I was proud to support the Pain-Capable Unborn Protection Act on the House floor.   As a society, it is our duty to speak for those who cannot speak for themselves and allow them the right to be born. I have been a lifelong supporter of the unborn and I am proud to cosponsor and support this legislation that will ban abortions past 20 weeks. I hope the Senate and President Trump act quickly to stand up for the unborn and make this important legislation the law of the land.

Today the former Equifax CEO Richard Smith is testifying before the House Committee on Financial Services. Shortly, I will be demanding answers about when, how, and why this happened. Watch the hearing here: http://bit.ly/23X4pol

This week, the House of Representatives passed the Fiscal Year 2018 budget which will serve as the foundation for  growing our nation’s economy, reining in the national debt, and setting the stage for tax reform.
Wishing all the farmers across the 3rd District a safe harvest this October!

85 percent of Missourians' electricity is generated by coal combustion. I am incredibly pleased the Trump Administration announced today it will roll back a rule that would eliminate our access to that affordable energy. Not only did this rule kill jobs by shuttering power plants, it was also estimated to cost American consumers approximately $40 billion in new cost each year.   It is my hope the Trump Administration will continue rolling back regulations that have made everyday life practically unaffordable for many families and stifled growth in nearly every part of our economy.

This week I had the honor of commemorating Specialist Jeffrey L. White Jr. and all he gave to our great country. I am incredibly pleased the House of Representatives unanimously passed my legislation that will designate the facility of the United States Postal Service in Pacific as the "Specialist Jeffrey L. White, Jr. Post Office."  While the naming of this post office is not nearly enough to honor Jeffrey White nor will it heal the pain felt each and every day by the family he left behind, it is my sincere hope each time the Whites and individuals in Pacific walk by this building, they are reminded of just how grateful and proud we are to call Specialist White one of our own.

On National Farmer Day, my family, staff, and myself, join all Missourians in sending a heartfelt thank you to our state's farmers, ranchers, and producers. You represent the very best our state has to offer. I am proud of the vital role you play in our rural communities and the contribution you make each and every day to not only feed our country, but the world. Thank you.
I just received a video of my hometown (St. Elizabeth) boys basketball team making a buzzer beater shot. Very impressive!

Last week, I had the opportunity to present the Jefferson City Jays baseball team with a congratulatory letter on their first place win in the 2017 Missouri Class 5 Baseball State Championship.   With a record of 31-2, it is clear the Jays were a championship team all year. I was pleased to have the opportunity to recognize the players and coaches for bringing home the state championship to their school and community.

The majority of us have a mother, sister, daughter, aunt, or a friend who has fought breast cancer. That is why I introduced the Mobile Mammography Promotion Act today.   This bill will increase access to breast cancer screening by providing relief from the federal fuel excise tax for "mammovans." We must ensure regular mammography screenings are available to all Americans regardless of  location because early detection and treatment is critical to defeating breast cancer.
I had the pleasure of meeting the Fowler family who traveled from Wentzville to Washington for a few days! I hope you enjoyed the tour of the Capitol and have fun while you are here!

My Jefferson City office has internship openings for the Spring 2018 semester. This internship will provide an opportunity for students to obtain experience from working in a congressional office. Interns in my offices assist staff with various projects on a day to day basis.   Any student can apply no matter the major they have selected.   For more information, please call my Jefferson City office and a member of my staff can answer any questions about the internship program!

During the month of November, we recognize National Entrepreneurship Month. Entrepreneurship is the fuel to our country's engine and I want to ask Missourians to recognize these individuals who drive creativity and make our economy stronger each day.

Tomorrow, we pause to honor the service and sacrifice of every man and woman who has worn the uniform of our great nation.   This Veterans Day, and every day, please join me in thanking our heroes and their families for their service to this great nation. That small gesture can go a long way. And the most honorable in our society have certainly earned it. God bless our veterans and God bless the United States of America.

Good luck to all the deer hunters in Missouri! With deer season officially underway, be sure to wear orange and please check out the Missouri Department of Conservation website for deer hunting tips and regulations. I hope all the 3rd District hunters have a successful season!

Today marks a truly historic day. After years of listening to the American people, the House of Representatives passed a pro-family, pro-growth tax reform bill.  The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act will lead to the creation of an additional 19,166 jobs in Missouri and raise after tax income for middle class Missouri families by $2,421. Additionally, the 62,280 families in the 3rd District who claim the child tax credit will see an increased credit from $1,000 to $1,600 per child.   This is a major step toward giving Americans the tax system they deserve and providing our economy the boost it needs to create more jobs and increase pay for Missouri families.

Thank you to everyone who participated in the women-owned small business roundtables in St. Charles and Washington, Missouri. With the willingness and spirit of these small business owners across the 3rd District, we have local coffee shops, stores, and small firms engaged in every sector of our economy. Currently, there are 11.3 million women-owned small businesses in the U.S. that generate $1.6 trillion in receipts per year. Without their entrepreneurial spirit and commitment to the community, life in the U.S. and Missouri would be a lot different.
This Thanksgiving I hope you enjoy time with your loved ones, share blessings and good stories, and eat a little too much turkey. From my family to yours, have a safe and very Happy Thanksgiving!

Small Business Saturday serves as the kickoff of the holiday shopping season for small business owners throughout Missouri.   When you shop local, you are supporting your neighbors and your community, and by shopping at these small businesses, you will be supporting 36 percent of retail trade employees in Missouri. #shoplocal

Earlier today I joined Maria Bartiromo and her panel on Fox Business News to discuss President Trump's visit to St. Charles today and tax reform. Watch my segment here: http://video.foxbusiness.com/v/5662021491001/?#sp=show-clips

It was an honor having President Trump in Missouri’s 3rd District today.The President’s choice to come to St. Charles and speak directly with us about how tax reform will help families in our state keep more of their own money shows just how important our region is to the economic success of our country.  I thank President Trump for his leadership and look forward to continuing to work with him on solving the problems we face as a nation.

When our nation was attacked at Pearl Harbor on the morning of December 7, 1941, our brave men and women in uniform fought as best they could amidst a devastating and unprovoked attack. In the wake of that tragedy, our greatest generation showed a resolve and tenacity that would lead to ultimate victory in the Pacific.  Today we honor the courage and sacrifice of those Pearl Harbor heroes.

Over the past several years, I have led the effort to combat Operation Choke Point, the Department of Justice and Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation-led initiative that sought to cut off legal businesses from the financial services they need to survive.   Last night, the House of Representatives passed my bill to end Operation Choke Point with a vote of 395-2. Next stop: the Senate.
Many thanks to the American Red Cross for coming to the House of Representatives so members and staff could sign holiday cards that will be sent to our service members!

This is truly a historic day for Missouri and the United States. The goal of tax reform is broken down in three ways: more jobs, fairer taxes, and bigger paychecks for families across the country.   This bill cuts taxes at every income level, doubles the standard deduction and child tax credit, and reduces loopholes, meaning Missourian’s can keep more of their hard-earned money while ensuring everyone pays their fair share. It achieves all of the goals President Trump and Congress set out to accomplish and will get our nation’s economy back on track.   I look forward to President Trump signing this legislation into law and giving Americans the best Christmas gift a government can give it citizens: more freedom and less taxes.

I hope everyone has a wonderful Christmas with loved ones and friends. I encourage you to take a moment and enjoy traditions you may have or create new ones with your children and family.   On behalf of my family and my staff, I wish everyone a blessed Merry Christmas!
